children.subject:
In general, it's hard to answer that question without knowing what year you are and if you're referring to EE16A or 16B. In this case, all seats for declared-LSCS students are full for 16A. The seats for LSCS students in 16B (all years) are still open. Please see 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/eecs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy for more info on EE-enrollment policies.
Should I be put on the waitlist if I add the class as a declared CS major?

Until now you had to be a CS scholar to enroll in them, however now that CS Scholars have been enrolled, these sections are open to all students. About half the students in the 16A sections will be CS Scholars.
Could you please clarify if you need to be a CS scholar to enroll in them, or if they are open to all students now? Thanks!

I'm aware of the policy about EE16B. I'm asking specifically what you meant when you replied "now that CS Scholars have been enrolled, these sections are open to all students." As a declared non-EECS COE major, i fall under category 5 in the link provided. So, I'm wondering what the enrollment timeline is like.

I was under the impression you meant that the period when ALL STUDENTS would be allowed, and since I'm in one of the categories with reserved seats I figured that would allow me to enroll myself. 

 Since I'm unable to join the class, do I need to be manually added to the class?

These sections were invisible before and no students other than CS Scholars were able to enroll or waitlist them. These are now open. If students meet the enrollment priorities and those enrollment categories are not full, they may enroll. If they are full, they may now waitlist for these sections. If they do not meet the enrollment categories, they can waitlist these sections. In terms of timeline, at the end of the enrollment policy for EE16B it says that all unused reserved will be released when the Adjustment Period begins. 

Your category (non-EECS COE) filled during Phase I. You should be able to waitlist, but not enroll unless seats open in your category.

Does that make sense?

yes that makes much more sense, I didn't know they were invisible :).

Thanks!

I attempted to enroll in the mentioned 16B sections as an Engineering Physics major, and it doesn't seem to let me still. Above it was said that these sections are open to all students. Is there a reason I'm still being put on the waitlist (even though i selected sections that were listed as open and have space available)?

history.content:
The following secondary sections were previously closed to CS Scholars and are now open for enrollment:

EE16A: Lab 104 & Dis 204

EE16B: Lab 103 & Dis 203
history.subject: EE16AB labs & discussions now open for enrollment
